macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. stocks close at fresh records after mixed jobs report
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose about 0.6% to a new all‑time high near 6,966, the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained roughly 0.5% to a record above 49,500, and the Nasdaq Composite climbed about 0.8%, as investors interpreted a mixed December employment report as consistent with eventual Fed rate cuts but likely not at the upcoming meeting.

items.title: Labor market data show slower hiring but lower unemployment
items.summary: The latest U.S. jobs report showed employers added fewer positions than economists expected, while the unemployment rate improved more than forecast, reinforcing a "low‑hire, low‑fire" labor market seen as reducing recession risk but also tempering expectations for near‑term Fed easing.

items.title: Fed rate‑cut odds for upcoming meeting fall after jobs report
items.summary: Following the employment data, futures markets lowered the implied probability of an interest‑rate cut at the Federal Reserve’s next meeting to about 5%, down from roughly 11% the prior day, signaling investors now see a smaller chance of an imminent policy move even as they still expect cuts later in the year.

items.title: Treasury yields ease slightly as market digests jobs data
items.summary: The 10‑year U.S. Treasury yield slipped to around 4.16% from 4.19% the previous session, reflecting modestly lower long‑term growth and inflation expectations after the mixed labor market report.

items.title: Broader U.S. equity benchmarks extend strong multi‑month gains
items.summary: The U.S. broad market index (US500) climbed to roughly 6,972, up about 0.7% on the session and around 1.2% over the past month, leaving it nearly 19% higher than a year earlier amid ongoing strength in large‑cap stocks.

items.title: Vistra surges on 20‑year nuclear power deal with Meta
items.summary: Power producer Vistra’s shares jumped about 10.5% after it announced a 20‑year agreement to supply electricity from three nuclear plants to Meta Platforms, highlighting continued energy‑supply deals tied to AI‑driven data‑center growth.

items.title: Oklo rises after nuclear fuel and data‑center partnership with Meta
items.summary: Nuclear startup Oklo gained roughly 7.9% after disclosing a deal with Meta Platforms to help secure nuclear fuel and advance its planned facility in Pike County, Ohio, adding to a string of AI‑related power‑supply agreements.

items.title: Housing stocks rally on White House plan to lower mortgage rates
items.summary: Homebuilders and other housing‑related companies advanced after President Trump proposed a plan involving up to $200 billion in mortgage‑bond purchases to push down mortgage rates, reminiscent of prior Fed quantitative‑easing programs in the housing market.

items.title: WD‑40 shares fall on weaker‑than‑expected quarterly profit
items.summary: WD‑40 stock dropped about 6.6% after the company reported quarterly earnings below analyst estimates, though management attributed the softness mainly to timing issues and reaffirmed full‑year guidance.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Morgan Stanley files with SEC for Bitcoin and Solana ETFs
items.summary: Morgan Stanley has submitted filings to the U.S. SEC to launch exchange-traded funds tied to the prices of Bitcoin and Solana, marking one of the most significant moves yet by a major U.S. bank toward regulated crypto investment products and signaling growing institutional comfort with ETF-based crypto exposure.[1]

items.title: Truebit (TRU) token collapses 99.9% after exploit draining 8,535 ETH
items.summary: Truebit’s TRU token crashed by 99.9% after an exploit of an older smart contract allegedly allowed an attacker to extract 8,535 ETH (around $26.6 million) by acquiring TRU at near-zero cost and selling it back for ether, reigniting concerns about legacy contract vulnerabilities.[1]

items.title: Bitcoin trades back above $90,000 amid bullish technical signals
items.summary: Bitcoin has reclaimed the $90,000 level, with some technical analysts highlighting what they describe as a strong bullish setup that may indicate seller exhaustion, though these views are framed as opinion rather than financial advice.[2]

items.title: VanEck models potential Bitcoin price of $2.9 million by 2050
items.summary: Asset manager VanEck published a long-term model suggesting Bitcoin could rise about 32x from roughly $90,000 to $2.9 million per coin by 2050 under a 'base-case' scenario tied to reserve-asset adoption, while also citing other bullish forecasts and noting current ETF demand around $90k remains fragile.[4]

items.title: Altcoins Polygon (POL), Aptos (APT), Midnight (NIGHT) show heightened volatility
items.summary: Polygon’s POL rebounded roughly 37% from a new all‑time low and is attempting to hold its 50‑day EMA, Aptos (APT) faces an 11.31 million token unlock that could pressure price after a recent 7.6% drop, and Midnight (NIGHT) has fallen about 26% amid a developing downtrend and broken support.[3]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Deep Delta Learning and Falcon-H1R introduce new approaches for efficient neural architectures and small reasoning models
items.summary: A recent AI bulletin highlights **Deep Delta Learning**, a neural architecture that generalizes residual networks via a single scalar gate, and **Falcon-H1R**, a 7B-parameter model optimized for reasoning that rivals models up to seven times larger on benchmarks while improving token efficiency, inference speed, and chain-of-thought performance.[1]

items.title: DeepSeek proposes Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections to stabilize large transformer training
items.summary: DeepSeek researchers introduce **Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections (mHC)**, a transformer architecture change targeting gradient explosion in multi-lane residual networks, reporting worst-case gradient amplification around 1.6 instead of ~3000 in large-scale models, which could improve stability of very deep or wide transformers.[1]

items.title: Alpamayo 1 VLA and AlpaSim stack advance physical AI for autonomous driving
items.summary: A new physical-AI stack features **Alpamayo 1**, a 10B-parameter vision-language-action model that outputs driving trajectories with reasoning traces, supported by **AlpaSim**, an open-source closed-loop autonomous driving simulator and over 1,700 hours of real-world driving data, enabling teacher–student distillation into smaller deployable models and robust edge-case testing.[1]

items.title: MIT and Microsoft use AI-designed molecular sensors for earlier cancer detection
items.summary: MIT and Microsoft researchers have developed **CleaveNet**, an AI system that designs peptide-based molecular sensors cleaved by proteases overactive in cancer cells, turning subtle enzyme activity into detectable signals and potentially enabling earlier, more precise cancer diagnostics and targeted therapies.[2][3]
items.source: MIT News via Center for Data Innovation; Daily Digest on AI and Emerging Technologies

items.title: Neuromorphic AI algorithm from Sandia enables more efficient scientific supercomputing
items.summary: Scientists at Sandia National Laboratories created an algorithm that maps fluid-dynamics equations into spiking-neuron activity on neuromorphic hardware, allowing complex simulations to run with significantly lower energy consumption than traditional CPU/GPU-based supercomputers while maintaining accuracy.[2]

items.title: Boston Dynamics trains humanoid robots for factory work using skill recombination
items.summary: Boston Dynamics unveiled an AI-powered humanoid robot that learns factory tasks by watching humans, mapping observed actions into a reusable skill library and recombining those skills to perform new tasks autonomously, supported by 3D perception for real-time adjustments in manipulation and balance.[2]

items.title: EngineAI showcases T800 humanoid and PM01 agent platforms at CES 2026
items.summary: EngineAI Robotics Technology presented the **T800** full-scale humanoid robot and **PM01** lightweight embodied agent at CES 2026, emphasizing application-ready embodied intelligence with live demos of coordinated whole-body motion and fine motor control aimed at real-world human–robot collaboration scenarios.[3]
items.source: Daily Digest on AI and Emerging Technologies

items.title: Hexagon Robotics and Microsoft partner on humanoid robotics for data-driven manufacturing
items.summary: Hexagon Robotics announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft to develop production-ready humanoid systems for manipulation and inspection, combining Hexagon’s robotics and sensor fusion with Microsoft Azure’s cloud, edge, and real-time intelligence platforms and leveraging multimodal vision-language-action and reinforcement/imitative learning frameworks.[3]
items.source: Daily Digest on AI and Emerging Technologies

items.title: LMArena raises $150M to scale large-scale AI evaluation platform
items.summary: AI evaluation startup **LMArena** closed a $150 million funding round at a $1.7 billion valuation to expand its technical and research teams, aiming to deepen real-world LLM assessment using feedback from over 5 million monthly users and to broaden its platform for systematic AI benchmarking.[3]
items.source: Daily Digest on AI and Emerging Technologies

items.title: Siemens and NVIDIA expand partnership to build industrial AI operating system at CES 2026
items.summary: At CES 2026, Siemens and NVIDIA announced an expanded partnership focused on an AI-accelerated portfolio for the end-to-end industrial value chain, effectively moving toward an industrial AI "operating system" that integrates simulation, automation, and generative AI for design, production, and operations.[8]

items.title: Tech at CES 2026 highlights practical assistive AI over novelty gadgets
items.summary: Coverage of CES 2026 notes that while vendors promoted gimmicky AI products such as AI-enabled toothbrushes and toilets, the more substantive trend was toward AI that delivers tangible assistance and health-related benefits, reflecting industry and consumer pushback against overhyped, low-value applications.[6]

items.title: Harvard and University of Pittsburgh launch major AI and data science initiatives
items.summary: The **Harvard Data Science Initiative** is expanding interdisciplinary AI and ML projects across health, climate, and agriculture, while the University of Pittsburgh launched the **Hub for AI and Data Science Leadership (HAIL)** to coordinate AI research, education, and responsible data science practices across the institution.[4]

items.title: Multi-agent and domain-specific models emerge as key trend for healthcare genAI in 2026
items.summary: Industry analysis predicts that regulated sectors like healthcare will increasingly rely on **multi-agent systems** and **specialty-specific models** tuned to biomedical data and clinical workflows, as general-purpose LLMs face cost, accuracy, and compliance challenges, with domain-specific models already outperforming general ones in documentation and drug discovery tasks.[5]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Consumer Tech Dominates CES 2026 as Showfloor Opens in Las Vegas
items.summary: The 2026 Consumer Electronics Show officially opened in Las Vegas with a flood of new consumer hardware, including TVs, smart home devices, wearables and robotics, as major brands like Samsung, LG, Lenovo and others used the show for their first big product announcements of the year.[2] Live coverage highlights hands‑on impressions of new gadgets such as updated smartwatches and home devices, along with a packed schedule of company press events.[2]

items.title: Lego Unveils SMART Play Platform for Connected Brick Experiences at CES
items.summary: The LEGO Group announced LEGO SMART Play, a new platform that integrates physical bricks with digital technology to create more interactive, connected play experiences, positioning it as a major evolution of its product ecosystem.[3] Introduced at CES 2026, the company describes SMART Play as a way to "bring brick creations to life" and expand how children and families engage with Lego sets.[3]

items.title: Lego Showcases New Smart Brick Technology as Flagship CES 2026 Announcement
items.summary: During CES 2026 press day, Lego highlighted new Smart Brick technology as a core component of its broader SMART Play initiative, using the show to formally present its latest interactive building products.[2] The announcement was part of a wave of pre‑show and press‑day launches that set the tone for the rest of the CES news cycle.[2]

items.title: Best of CES 2026 Awards Set to Highlight Standout New Gadgets and Emerging Tech
items.summary: Engadget is finalizing its "Best of CES 2026" awards, covering categories such as Best in Show and Best Emerging Technology, after vetting hundreds of companies and devices on the show floor.[2] Early standouts include products like Lego Smart Play and IXI autofocus, reflecting broader trends in smart consumer hardware and imaging tech.[2]
